title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SACRAMENTO – On a night where the final box score will be lost to time, one name is eternally etched into the record books: Mitch Richmond. In a heart-stopping 101-99 victory for the Sacramento Kings over the Portland Trail Blazers, Richmond authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a career-high 47 points and single-handedly carrying his team to an improbable win.

The Kings' offense often seemed to be "get the ball to Mitch and get out of the way." He was an unstoppable force, a whirlwind of mid-range jumpers and powerful drives to the hoop. While his teammates struggled to find their rhythm, Richmond was a model of relentless efficiency, shouldering the entire scoring load against a formidable Portland squad. Isaiah Rider’s 23 points for the Blazers, while valiant, were merely a supporting act to Richmond’s masterpiece.

The game came down to a final, frantic possession. With the score knotted and seconds ticking away, there was no mystery where the ball was going. Richmond, hounded by desperate defenders, created just enough space to get a shot off. The buzzer sounded as the ball ripped through the net, sending the home crowd into a state of pure pandemonium and cementing his legendary status for the franchise.

In the annals of Kings history, this night belongs to one man. It was not merely a win, but a coronation. Mitch Richmond didn’t just beat the Trail Blazers; he delivered a historic 47-point tour de force that will be remembered long after the final score is forgotten.
